Reviews.Title: Bloatware and memory issues
Reviews.Author: H. Coffill "reckless-abandon"
Reviews.Content: TMobile bundled this phone with so much locked-in bloatware it gives me "out-of-memory" issues EVERY day.I've switched off as much auto-updating of software I do not want and will not use (I'm lookin' at YOU Photobucket!) and I can't really install anything I'd like to use without getting an out-of-memory error.There is no way to shunt software to the 2G SIM card, so the card remains fairly useless, except for photo storage. Even at that, I need to keep reminding the camera to save the pictures there, and not the internal storage--which, have I mentioned?--is miniscule.Why, oh, why, TMobile, do you not give your consumers the ability to remove software from their phone that they do not want?My contract is up in March and I'm done.

Reviews.Title: Warranty replacements fee keeps them in business.
Reviews.Author: Hmpayton
Reviews.Content: I originally got this phone with a new line in September of 2011. I'm now on my 5th replacement through the warranty exchange program and, while it's nice to have that protection, I shouldn't have to replace the phone that much. First phone: Sept 21, 2011- October 22,2011 (brand new)- Screen no longer turned on when the keyboard was slid out. Second phone: October 22, 2011- November 15, 2011- Same deal. Third phone: November 15, 2011- December 28, 2011- Phone reset every time the keyboard shut. Fourth phone: December 28, 2011- January 2, 2013- FINALLY got a phone that worked for longer than a month. Stopped being recognized by any computer as mass storage. Fifth phone: January 2, 2013- ??  Moving on: Thanks to all the normal bloatware, the phone's memory is eaten up quicker than most Samsungs. Even with app-killers or just clearing out old data periodically, still insane how quickly it gets bogged down. Battery life is good, except the fact that the damn battery only lived for just over a year and I had to buy a new one. I kept the old one to see what would happen...now it's so swollen it won't even stay in the phone. (Ok, so that's not a phone deal...but seriously, the last time I had this issue was with a first-gen Lithium-Ion battery years ago.) Soft keyboard is nice in a tactile way but gets stained, with no options for cleaning unless you disassemble the phone, too easily. Upsides: Phone is rather sturdy physically. Didn't have phones 1,2, or 3 long enough to drop them but phone 4 was dropped numerous times and lived to tell the tale of a new text message. For being free, it's done everything I needed it too. No problems with sound quality, dropped calls, etc. Easy to work with and would be best fit for a starter smart phone. Blue paint chips easily but the under material is also blue so it doesn't look terrible when it chips. (A case would solve that issue though as well.) In summary: Don't buy this phone if you know up from down (second smart phone I'd ever have and was coming off of a Huawei Comet) or if you don't plan to carry insurance for the warranty replacement deal.

Reviews.Title: worked for a year
Reviews.Author: C. Light
Reviews.Content: just went out on me after warranty period. the lower keys went first then screen now after almost 300 bucks out of pocket its toast.... going at&t; gravity smart 2 which I hope is better quality. I love samsung this one though itsnt quality

Reviews.Title: Perfect for those who just want a phone with benefits...
Reviews.Author: PlanetHell "EmbraceThatSmothers"
Reviews.Content: I have seen too many reviews complaining that this item cannot hold a trillion pictures or apps, and though they might not say it directly, that is what they are talking about.This phone is great. It is not expensive, and as long as you don't abuse it, it lasts for a long time. I have one going on three years and it's fine.It does overload or say "out of memory" if you have a ton of apps, or a ton of pictures, but it has a memory card for pictures (it comes with the item when you buy it). And I do mean a ton, I didn't delete any until there will over 100...So the complaints are coming from people who have overloaded a phone with benefits. This is not a ipad, or an iphone5, but it's perfectly capable of getting the job done. Buy it if you love the benefits of modern technology, but not if you are in need of a ton of memory, that is really all one can say to complain about it, and it wasn't made that way to begin with.I also must say I much prefer this keypad style as the touchscreen kinds can make mistakes. It is also a nice small size.

Reviews.Title: ** DON'T BUY THIS PHONE **
Reviews.Author: ROBERT BONNER
Reviews.Content: This by far has to be the worst first smart phone experience that one could have. TMobile & Samsung should be ashamed for sticking people with this crappy phone.If you want to find out for yourself - simply Google Samsung Gravity Smart internal memory errors & you'll see the sea of complaints about about this phone's ridiculously low internal memory.I bought this Samsung Gravity Smart phone in November 2011 primarily because of the Wi-Fi calling, large screen & QWERTY keyboard thinking I really only needed to be able to make calls when I'm at home & my crappy TMobile reception fades out. This phone has a shamefully non-existent 150 Megabytes of internal memory compared to most phones that have at least 4 gigabytes.So what does that mean for you?;it means that you'll never be able to install ANY APP what so ever. It also means that you won't be able to receive any text messages because the memory will always be too low to allow the phone to receive messages. You'll be able to send them, but you'll daily have to delete every text message.Trust me even if you're thinking that's okay, I'll only be using this phone for just this or that, I don't need a bunch of apps or games - it won't be okay... it won't :( You will be frustrated.Even though it has virtually non-existent internal memory, T-Mobile & Samsung still chose to ship it preinstalled with 100 Mb of junk software that further helps to make the problem worst.Please save yourself the inevitable headache that is sure to come & buy a different phone.Also when you call T-Mobile to complain about the phone not functioning properly, you'll literally get a rep that tells you to check to see if apps are installed on the SD card. Well most apps aren't written to be installed on SD so that suggestion sucks. Also, even though an app may be saved to SD, the data it generates while you're using it goes in the internal memory. So guess what, you're still suck!If you look on Samsung's site for internal memory problems, well here's how severe it is. They answer every other question about this phone online... YOU HAVE TO CALL THEM TO GET INTERNAL MEMORY ISSUES ADDRESSED!That's how bad this phone is, they don't even want to answer the questions in a public forum. They throw rocks & then hide their hands! They're ashamed of even making this phone with this ridiculously low functionality.If you only want a pretty phone that you can only make calls on, then this is the phone for you. It has pretty colors, nice screen, the keyboard isn't that good - it doesn't have arrow keys & a lot of the symbols take forever to get to like $.Again to sum it up 150Mb of internal memory is a horrible thing for anyone, even a teen of housewife to deal with. And I got the phone free & I still paid too much for it. With an extended 2 year T-Mobile contract (which they messed up the billing & charged me 3 times what I should've been paying - TMobile you all have to get it together - please) & it still isn't worth what I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Lots of Issues
Reviews.Author: Mely
Reviews.Content: This was my first smartphone ever and I was very excited to get it but I had nothing but problems with it. It has a serious memory storage issue of just a few hundred MB even though I inserted a memory card with 8 GB of memory. This phone did not allow me to use the external memory and I even took it to a tmobile store and they told me this phone just couldn't use external memory so I better just get another phone. I was sooo frustrated that I could not even receive texts for days because the memory was full. I had to manually delete data at least once a week and that would cause me to delete my contacts. It was also sooo embarrassing because the calls would drop all the time! Even when I was talking to possible empoyers! I felt awful. I hope no one has to go through this. I can't believe such a dis-functioning phone is on the market and actually has good reviews. For me, this phone was basically a warning that there are some awful products out there.

Reviews.Title: Phone won't last its warranty period
Reviews.Author: caralily
Reviews.Content: I loved a lot about this phone when I first got it. I prefer slide keyboard texting to touchscreen and wanted a phone with wifi and 3g capability. Being on t-mobile pay as you go, this limits the choices of phones, so I chose this one, having had a regular gravity previously that still works. Within two months, I began having to delete my data almost daily if I wanted to use wifi or 3g. Then, six months in, the phone started dying over a week-long period. One day, calls worked fine and everything was fine. Then, I tried to call for a reservation at a restaurant and found that I could only be heard if speaker was off, but could only hear people with speaker on. So, I reset my phone, hoping that would help - it didn't - and then continued to use the camera and texting features as I searched for the receipt. A few days later, the touchscreen started freezing once and awhile until it stopped working altogether. My phone had a few scratches on the back cover but was otherwise kept in good condition, mind you. Again, I did a factory reset on my phone to no avail. Unfortunately, I've moved 3 times since I bought the phone at a store, so I don't think I'll find the receipt for warranty service, and I can't call the service number anyway because I don't have a phone. Really, a phone should not just stop working for no reason after 6 months, especially because warranty service usually has a fee. I've heard that most of these phones end up getting turned in under warranty, too. Do yourself a favor and don't buy this phone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: doug smith
Reviews.Content: I loved the phone it works great it was really cheap and everything was there I I I I I liked it

Reviews.Title: Dead screen
Reviews.Author: Harold Henson
Reviews.Content: We have this phone from Fido in Canada.  The screen became unresponsive after a year and a half.  Other than that,  it is a good phone except that version 2.2 of Android does lack the occasional feature.

Reviews.Title: RUN FORREST RUN
Reviews.Author: Luke G
Reviews.Content: I would absolutely not recommend buying this phone. After I'd had it for less than eight months the lock button stopped working, and would instead reboot the phone. A month or so after that the lock button menu started popping up randomly, then the phone would reboot itself. In the last ten minutes of attempting to send a single text message, it has rebooted eight times and put itself into airplane mode. Samsung, please drug test whichever employees designed this.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this phone for anyone needing a replacement. Good quality and price, but not enough storage space for apps. Take into consideration a micro sd card for more storage.

Reviews.Title: phone
Reviews.Author: kanefam
Reviews.Content: The phone freezes all the time and the battery has to be removed and put back in to reset it.  It looks great but it doesn't work right.

Reviews.Title: Sucks!
Reviews.Author: jodyok
Reviews.Content: The memory sucks, you can't add many apps on it at all. One month after I got it, it totally died. Luckily the seller totally refunded me.

Reviews.Title: Let me clear this up....
Reviews.Author: YesItsBradZ
Reviews.Content: I have had three of these phones and the first two broke fair and square (lol). I see a lot of people complaining about the phone not working or freezing.... I dont know what these guys are doing with this phone but its not really an app/gaming/movie/mod/memory guzzling intensive device. It's a gravity series for petes sake. Its REALLY GOOD for listening to music, creating ringtones, playing the first angry birds, doodle jump, and using the internet.Get a Samsung tablet if you want to do some app intensivve things.Or read a book. Like an actual book.

Reviews.Title: STRESS!!!
Reviews.Author: D.
Reviews.Content: ***Sigh***Its just not worth the hassle - little memory so you have to be constantly deleting stuff, too many restrictions (and worst if you get it from T-Mobile), screen went 1 yr after being well cared for and the list goes on. Love you Samsung, but this one scored low - loved the idea with the key pad and touch screen... but i'm convinced you can do better.

Reviews.Title: Could be better
Reviews.Author: Crazitalk
Reviews.Content: It works, but it could easily be better.Issues:The contrast between the primary characters and alt characters on the keyboard is not good, unless the sun is out the alt characters on the keyboard can barely be seen. Utterly useless in the dark.The processor is rather slow and interactions often get bogged down.The phone storage is very limited. There is a large amount of bloatware on the device and on a regular basis we have had to delete messages and app info on a regular basis to ensure we can get messages.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!!
Reviews.Author: eerrad213
Reviews.Content: This phone works perfectly and has been easy on drops as in few scratches, this was bought for someone else but I have seen it  constantly.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for the buck
Reviews.Author: TY
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 12yr old she loves it. The phone has many apps and easy to navigate. Good buy!

Reviews.Title: Won't last a year
Reviews.Author: George "gxbacher"
Reviews.Content: Youll be lucky if this phone lasts a year. Do yourself a favor and Google it. You'll then know to pick a different phone.

Reviews.Title: perfect phone
Reviews.Author: lucy
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my eleven year old daughter and she loves it! She only had some problems before we got her internet but now it works great. I don't know how this phone got so many bad reviews. I would highly recommend this for a kid's first phone.I don't know why people would give their kids Iphone 5's!

Reviews.Title: great cell
Reviews.Author: pj
Reviews.Content: nice cell theprice was great works wonderful i recommond it. it came on time i love the cell phone features

Reviews.Title: good and sturdy
Reviews.Author: N. Costa
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone for 2 years, it's been super reliable. If you have to text, check emails, have some music on it and make calls, it's super good. I love that android gives us downloaded voice mail, and has a back button. Battery was super good for the first year, then started having to charge every day after that. Memory went after a year too, and you cannot get rid of unwanted apps, which takes precious space and clutters. You can buy memory card to expand though. The keyboard is very useful because i text in two languages, and the auto fill text only works for English, so I text in Portuguese using the keyboard.  Did not work when I went overseas. If you have to unlock, give yourself at least two weeks to get the code. I was building a portfolio during these 2 years and many photos I used, I took with this phone. Saved me, always.

Reviews.Title: Replacement
Reviews.Author: Alluundra
Reviews.Content: I had one before for 3 years and love it! It lasted even with a toddler. Had to get a new one because the screen quit being responsive. The phone survives a lot and keeps on going. I love it and found it affordable.

Reviews.Title: no problems at all
Reviews.Author: erikaT94
Reviews.Content: i had this phone once bfore and i had no problems at all wit this phone it work fine for me

Reviews.Title: No problem with phone
Reviews.Author: Ellen Wasserman
Reviews.Content: I have a Gravity Smart phone & have had no problem downloading items & no problem texting. The only problem is that at times, things take a while to download.

Reviews.Title: As described (kinda).
Reviews.Author: Michael Spofford "4t5gunner"
Reviews.Content: I am not going to get into the software and functionality of the Phone. There are better places to do that research (Cnet.com, Android Authority ect)... The phone was brand new in the box with all required accessories and packed well and arrived quickly. However the description does not mention the color you will receive and the picture shows a Grey / Black phone. What I received was labeled as pink, although it is more of a reddish. Not that bed, had it been pink we would have had a problem!

smart phone
